lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot Maltese. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Maltese.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Maltese.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
Maltese is a **task management chatbot, optimised for use via a Command Line Interface** (CLI).
* Marking a task as done: mark
Add a todo task to your task list.
Add a deadline with a due date.
Add an event with start and end times.
Shows a list of all tasks in your task list.
Expected output when no tasks exist:
Marks the specified task as completed.
* Marks the task at the specified `INDEX`.
* The index refers to the index number shown in the displayed task list.
* The index **must be a positive integer** 1, 2, 3, …
Marks the specified task as not completed.
* Unmarks the task at the specified `INDEX`.
* The index refers to the index number shown in the displayed task list.
* The index **must be a positive integer** 1, 2, 3, …
okie this task is still doing
Deletes the specified task from the task list.
* Deletes the task at the specified `INDEX`.
* The index refers to the index number shown in the displayed task list.
* The index **must be a positive integer** 1, 2, 3, …
Finds tasks whose descriptions contain the given keyword.
* Only the task description is searched.
Here are the matching tasks in the list:
Maltese data are saved in tasks.txt automatically after any command that changes the data. There is no need to save manually.
| **Deadline** | deadline DESCRIPTION /by DEADLINE e.g., deadline assignment /by friday 3pm                                                                              |
| **Event**  | event DESCRIPTION /from START_TIME /to END_TIME e.g., event group meeting /from 2pm /to 4pm                                                                      |
* Parses user input and dispatches task commands.
* Errors are reported via printed messages.
* Marks or unmarks the task at the given 1-based index.
* Invalid or out-of-range indices print an error and do nothing.
* @param doneStatus True to mark as done; false to unmark.
public static void processMark(String taskNumber, boolean doneStatus, boolean isSilent) {
System.out.println("my list does not have so many tasks");
System.out.println(doneStatus ? "okie this task is done" : "okie this task is still doing");
* Adds a todo task from the given description.
* Blank descriptions print an error and are ignored.
public static void processTodo(String todoTask, boolean isSilent) {
System.out.println("no todo found pls todo something");
* Adds a deadline in the form "description /by when".
* Missing delimiter or blank fields print an error and are ignored.
public static void processDeadline(String deadlineTask, boolean isSilent) {
System.out.println("invalid deadline format pls do task /by deadline");
System.out.println("invalid deadline format pls do task /by deadline");
* Adds an event in the form "description /from start /to end".
* Missing delimiters or blank fields print an error and are ignored.
public static void processEvent(String eventTask, boolean isSilent) {
System.out.println("fake event pls put event task /from from /to to");
System.out.println("fake event pls put event task /from from /to to");
Event newEvent = new Event(task.strip(), from.strip(), to.strip());
* Deletes the task at the given 1-based index.
* Non-numeric or out-of-range indices print an error and are ignored.
System.out.println("I do not have that many tasks!");
* Prints tasks containing the given keyword.
* Null or blank keywords print an error and are ignored.
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in the list:");
System.out.println("No tasks in the list recognises this keyword");
* Null, blank, or unknown commands print an error and do nothing.
System.out.println("i don't recognise this at all");
* Handles persistence of tasks to and from a text file.
* Errors are reported via printed messages; in
* Adds a task parsed from a serialized line.
* Writes all tasks to the tasks file.
* I/O errors print an error message.
* Loads tasks from the tasks file.
* Missing file prints an error message.
System.out.println("failed to create a new file T-T");
System.out.println("created new file to store your tasks yippee");
System.out.println("this file cant be created" + e.getMessage());
* Maintains the in-memory list of tasks.
* Errors are reported via printed messages.
protected static ArrayList<Task> tasks = new ArrayList<>();
* Prints the task list with 1-based indices.
* Appends a task and persists the list.
* Provides a simple console UI for the Maltese chatbot.
* Prints the boot-up greeting and prompt.
System.out.println("Hello I'm Maltese, your personal chatbot!");
System.out.println("What can I do for you");
* Runs the interactive command loop until the user enters "bye".
* Input errors are handled by the command parser.
* Prints a generic error message for failures in the process loop.
* Represents a deadline task with a due time.
* Creates a deadline with the given description and due time.
* Returns the status icon with the deadline type prefix.
* @return {@code "[D]"} followed by the base status icon.
* @return Status icon, description, and due time.
* Represents an event with a start and end time.
* Creates an event with the given description and time range.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* Returns the status icon with the event type prefix.
* @return [E] followed by the base status icon.
* @return Status icon, description, start time, and end time.
* Represents a generic task with a description and completion status.
* Creates a task with the given description.
return (isDone ? "[X]" : "[ ]"); // mark done task with X
* @param isDone true to mark as done; false to mark as not done.
* Creates a todo with the given description.
* Returns the status icon with the todo type prefix.
* @return [T] followed by the base status icon.
event do even more stuff /from monday /to tuesday
